original: prakṛtir eṣām iyam /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam
translated: This is their nature.

original: kuśalā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽prakṛtir eṣām iyam / akuśalā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ akūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ  prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam akuśalāḥ dharmāḥ a kūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Virtuous dharmas are not hollow and not destroyed. Why is it so?🔽This is their nature. Non-virtuous dharmas are not hollow and not destroyed. Why is it so?

original: prakṛtir eṣām iyam / saṃskṛtā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽prakṛtir eṣām iyam / asaṃskṛtā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam saṃskṛtāḥ dharmāḥ a kūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ  prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam asaṃskṛtāḥ dharmāḥ akūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This is their nature. Conditioned dharmas are not hollow and not destroyed. Why is it so?🔽This is their nature. Unconditioned dharmas are not hollow and not destroyed. Why is it so?

original: prakṛtir eṣām iyam / sāsravā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam sa āsravāḥ dharmāḥ akūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This is their nature. Dharmas with outflows are not hollow and not destroyed. Why is it so?

original: prakṛtir eṣām iyam / anāsravā dharmā akūṭasthā avināśinaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ akūṭasthāḥ avināśinaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This is their nature. The undefiled dharmas are not deceptive and do not perish. Why is that?

original: prakṛtir eṣām iyam / anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇābhāvasvabhāvāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eṣām iyam anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa abhāva svabhāvāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: This is their nature. By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, all dharmas are essentially non-existent.

original: yat punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputraivaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: yat punar āyuṣman śāradvatī putra evam vadasi
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you asked:

original: kena kāraṇena rūpam anabhinirvṛttaṃ /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena rūpam an abhinirvṛttam
translated: For what reason is form unproduced?

original: kena kāraṇena vedanānabhinirvṛttā /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena vedanā an abhinirvṛttā
translated: For what reason is feeling unproduced?

original: kena kāraṇena saṃjñānabhinirvṛttā /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena saṃjñā an abhinirvṛttā
translated: For what reason is perception unproduced?

original: kena kāraṇena saṃskārā anabhinirvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena saṃskārāḥ an abhinirvṛttāḥ
translated: For what reason are volitional factors unproduced?🔽For what reason is consciousness unproduced?

original: kena kāraṇena vijñānam anabhinirvṛttam iti vadasi /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena vijñānam an abhinirvṛttam iti vadasi
translated: You say this.

original: evam etad āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam etat āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so. Why is that?

original: tathā hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra rūpam anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ /🔽vedanānabhisaṃskṛtā /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra rūpam an abhisaṃskṛtam  vedanā an abhisaṃskṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is because form is unconditioned.🔽Feeling is unconditioned.

original: saṃjñānabhisaṃskṛtā /
analyzed: saṃjñā an abhisaṃskṛtā
translated: Perception is unconditioned.

original: saṃskārā anabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Volitional factors are unconditioned.

original: vijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Consciousness is unconditioned. Why is that?

original: tathā hi rūpasyābhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi rūpasya abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: It is because form has no producer.

original: vedanāyā abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: vedanāyāḥ abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Feeling has no producer.

original: saṃjñāyā abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: saṃjñāyāḥ abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: There is no creator of perception.

original: saṃskārāṇām abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: There is no creator of volitional formations.

original: vijñānasyābhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: vijñānasya abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: There is no creator of consciousness.

original: cakṣur āyuṣmañ chāradvatiputrānabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ āyuṣmam chāradvati putra an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the eye is not created. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: śrotram anabhisaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: śrotram an abhisaṃskṛtam
translated: The ear is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: ghrāṇam anabhisaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: ghrāṇam an abhisaṃskṛtam
translated: The nose is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: jihvānabhisaṃskṛtā /
analyzed: jihvā an abhisaṃskṛtā
translated: The tongue is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: kāyo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kāyaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: The body is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: mano 'nabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The mind is not created. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: rūpam āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānabhisaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: rūpam āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra an abhisaṃskṛtam
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, form is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: śabdo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: śabdaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Sound is not created.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no creator.

original: gandho 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: gandhaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Smell is unconditioned.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no one who conditions it.

original: raso 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: rasaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Taste is unconditioned.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no one who conditions it.

original: sparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Touch is unconditioned.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no one who conditions it.

original: dharmā anabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Mental phenomena are unconditioned.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no one who conditions them.

original: cakṣurvijñānam āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / śrotravijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / ghrāṇavijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti śrotra vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti ghrāṇa vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Visual consciousness, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is unconditioned. Why is that?🔽Because there is no one who conditions it. Ear consciousness is unconditioned. Why is that?🔽Because there is no one who conditions it. Nose consciousness is unconditioned. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / jihvāvijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti jihvā vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because there is no one who conditions it. Tongue consciousness is unconditioned. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / kāyavijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti kāya vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because there is no one who conditions it. Body consciousness is unconditioned. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / manovijñānam anabhisaṃskṛtam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti manaḥ vijñānam an abhisaṃskṛtam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Mind consciousness is unconstructed. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no constructor.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśa āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ āyuṣman chāradvatīputra an abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Friend Śāriputra, eye contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / śrotrasaṃsparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti śrotra saṃsparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Ear contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / ghrāṇasaṃsparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Nose contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / jihvāsaṃsparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti jihvā saṃsparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Tongue contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / kāyasaṃsparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti kāya saṃsparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Body contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / manaḥsaṃsparśo 'nabhisaṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Because there is no constructor. Mind contact is unconstructed.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no constructor.

analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti vimokṣāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no one who creates them. The liberations are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'nabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti navā anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no creator. The nine successive absorptions are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: Because there is no creator. The doors to freedom—emptiness, freedom from characteristics, and freedom from longings—are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / abhijñā anabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti abhijñāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no creator. The forms of higher knowing are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / samādhayo 'nabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti samādhayaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no creator. The meditative absorptions are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / dhāraṇīmukhāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti dhāraṇīmukhāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: Because there is no creator. The dhāraṇī gateways are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / daśatathāgatabalāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti daśa tathāgata balāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: Because there is no creator. The ten powers of the tathāgatas are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / catvāri vaiśāradyāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti catvāri vaiśāradyāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: Because there is no creator. The four fearlessnesses are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'nabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no creator. The four kinds of detailed and thorough knowledge are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / mahāmaitry anabhisaṃskṛtā /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti mahāmaitrī anabhisaṃskṛtā
translated: Because there is no one who creates it. Great love is uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / mahākaruṇānabhisaṃskṛtā /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti mahā karuṇā an abhisaṃskṛtā
translated: Because there is no one who creates it. Great compassion is uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti / aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā anabhisaṃskṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ
translated: Because there is no one who creates it. The eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha are uncreated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhisaṃskartā nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhisaṃskartā na asti
translated: Because there is no one who creates it.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa rūpam anabhinirvṛttaṃ vedanānabhinirvṛttā saṃjñānabhinirvṛttā saṃskārā anabhinirvṛttā vijñānam anabhinirvṛttam /🔽yat punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputraivam āha /
analyzed: anena āyuṣman chāradvatī putra paryāyeṇa rūpam an abhinirvṛttam vedanā an abhinirvṛttā saṃjñā an abhinirvṛttā saṃskārāḥ an abhinirvṛttāḥ vijñānam an abhinirvṛttam  yat punar āyuṣman śāradvatīputra evam āha
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, form is unarisen, feeling is unarisen, perception is unarisen, volitional factors are unarisen, and consciousness is unarisen.

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣmañ subhūte yad anabhinirvṛttaṃ na tad rūpaṃ /🔽yā anabhinirvṛttā na sā vedanā /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte yat an abhinirvṛttam na tat rūpam  yā an abhinirvṛttā na sā vedanā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you asked why the unarisen is not form,🔽why the unarisen is not feeling,

original: yā anabhinirvṛttā na sā saṃjñā /
analyzed: yā an abhinirvṛttā na sā saṃjñā
translated: why the unarisen is not perception,

original: ye 'nabhinirvṛttā na te saṃskārā /
analyzed: ye na abhinirvṛttāḥ na te saṃskārāḥ
translated: why the unarisen is not volitional factors,

original: yad anabhinirvṛttaṃ na tad vijñānam iti vadasi /
analyzed: yat an abhinirvṛttam na tat vijñānam iti vadasi
translated: and why the unarisen is not consciousness.

original: evam etad āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam etat āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: It is so, Venerable Śāradvatīputra. Why is that?

original: tathā hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra rūpaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / vedanā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra rūpam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate vedanā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Because, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, form is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no arising or cessation.🔽For what has no arising or cessation, the transformation of its abiding is not discerned. Feeling is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no arising or cessation.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / saṃjñā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate saṃjñā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no arising or cessation, the transformation of its abiding is not discerned. Perception is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no arising or cessation.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / saṃskārāḥ prakṛtiśūnyā
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate saṃskārāḥ prakṛti śūnyā
translated: For what has no arising or cessation, the transformation of its abiding is not discerned. Formations are empty by nature,

original: yā ca prakṛtiśūnyās teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ
analyzed: yā ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam
translated: and what is empty by nature has no arising or cessation. For what has no arising or cessation, the transformation of its abiding

original: prajñāyate / vijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: prajñāyate vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: is not discerned. Consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no arising or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yasya nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change.

original: cakṣuḥ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / śrotraṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / ghrāṇaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate śrotram prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate ghrāṇam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: The eye is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.🔽For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. The ear is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.🔽For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. The nose is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / jihvā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate jihvā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. The tongue is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / kāyaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate kāyaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. The body is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / manaḥ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate manaḥ prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. The mind is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yasya nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate
translated: For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change.

original: rūpaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: rūpam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Form is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / śabdaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo 🔽na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / gandhaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate śabdaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ  na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate gandhaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. Sound is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.🔽For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. Smell is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / rasaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate rasaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production or cessation, there is no perception of its duration or change. Taste is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / sparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate sparśaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Contact is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / dharmāḥ prakṛtiśūnyā ye ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate dharmāḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ ye ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what does not arise or cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Phenomena are empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate /🔽cakṣurvijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / śrotravijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate  cakṣuḥ vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate śrotra vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what does not arise or cease, there is no perception of its duration or change.🔽Eye consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.🔽For what does not arise or cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Ear consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / ghrāṇavijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate ghrāṇa vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what does not arise or cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Nose consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / jihvāvijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / kāyavijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate jihvā vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate kāya vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change.🔽The tongue consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.🔽For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. The body consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / manovijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ yac ca prakṛtiśūnyaṃ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate manaḥ vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam yat ca prakṛti śūnyam tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. The mind consciousness is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yasya nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Eye contact is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / śrotrasaṃsparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate śrotra saṃsparśaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Ear contact is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature has no production or cessation.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / ghrāṇasaṃsparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / jihvāsaṃsparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate jihvā saṃsparśaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Nose contact is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.🔽For what does not arise or cease, there is no perception of its duration or change. Tongue contact is empty by nature, and what is empty by nature does not arise or cease.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / kāyasaṃsparśaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /

translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise is known. The perfection of wisdom is empty by nature, and that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.

translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The great emptiness is empty of any intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of any intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / paramārthaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate paramārtha śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is discerned. Ultimate emptiness is empty of an intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of an intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / saṃskṛtaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / atyantaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate saṃskṛta śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate asaṃskṛta śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate atyanta śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is discerned. Conditioned emptiness is empty of an intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of an intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.🔽For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is discerned. Unconditioned emptiness is empty of an intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of an intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.🔽For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is discerned. Ultimate emptiness is empty of an intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of an intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / anavarāgraśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate an avara agra śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is discerned. Emptiness of what is beginningless and endless is empty of an intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of an intrinsic nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / anavakāraśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate anavakāra śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The emptiness of non-rejection is empty by nature. And that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā y ā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / sarvadharmaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā y ā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate sarva dharma śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The emptiness of nature is empty by nature. And that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.🔽For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The emptiness of all phenomena is empty by nature. And that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.🔽For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The emptiness of specific characteristics is empty by nature. And that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthity anyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / anupalambhaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate anupalambha śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no continuance or change in continuance is known. The emptiness of non-apprehension is empty by nature. And that which is empty by nature has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / abhāvaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / svabhāvaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam abhāva śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate svabhāva śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise can be discerned. The emptiness of non-existence is naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no arising and no passing away.🔽For that which has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise can be discerned. The emptiness of inherent nature is naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise can be discerned. The emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence is naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no arising and no passing away.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate
translated: For that which has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise can be discerned.

original: smṛtyupasthānāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / samyakprahāṇāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate samyakprahāṇāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no arising and no passing away, no abiding or otherwise can be discerned. The right efforts are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / ṛddhipādā prakṛtiśūnyā y ā ca prakṛtiśūnyās teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / indriyāṇi prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ / yeṣāṃ
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate ṛddhipādā prakṛti śūnyāḥ ā ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate indriyāṇi prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ yeṣām
translated: For those who have no arising and no passing away, no alteration of their abiding is discerned. The bases of spiritual power are empty of nature. And those which are empty of nature, for them there is no arising and no passing away.🔽For those who have no arising and no passing away, no alteration of their abiding is discerned. The faculties are empty of nature. And those which are empty of nature, for them there is no arising and no passing away.

original: notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / balāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate balāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For those who have no arising and no passing away, no alteration of their abiding is discerned. The powers are empty of nature. And those which are empty of nature, for them there is no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / bodhyaṅgāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate bodhyaṅgāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For those who have no arising and no passing away, no alteration of their abiding is discerned. The factors of awakening are empty of nature. And those which are empty of nature, for them there is no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ prakṛtiśūnyo yaś ca prakṛtiśūnyaḥ tasya notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ prakṛti śūnyaḥ yaḥ ca prakṛti śūnyaḥ tasya na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For those who have no arising and no passing away, no alteration of their abiding is discerned. The noble eightfold path is empty of nature. And that which is empty of nature, for it there is no arising and no passing away.

original: yasya notpādo na vyayo na tasya sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / āryasatyāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasya sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate ārya satyāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what is not produced and does not cease, there is no apprehension of its duration or change. The noble truths are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no production and no cessation.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / dhyānāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / apramāṇāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate dhyānāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate apramāṇāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production and no cessation, there is no apprehension of its duration or change. The concentrations are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no production and no cessation.🔽For what has no production and no cessation, there is no apprehension of its duration or change. The immeasurables are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no production and no cessation.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ tāsāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate ārūpya samāpattayaḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ yā ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ tāsām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production and no cessation, there is no apprehension of its duration or change. The formless absorptions are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no production and no cessation.

original: yāsāṃ notpādo na vyayo na tāsāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ prakṛtiśūnyā ye ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yāsām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tāsām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ ye ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For what has no production and no cessation, there is no apprehension of its duration or change. The eight liberations are naturally empty, and what is naturally empty has no production and no cessation.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ prakṛtiśūnyā yāś ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ teṣāṃ notpādo
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate navā anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ yāḥ ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ
translated: Those which have no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of duration or change. The nine successive absorptions are naturally empty, and those which are naturally empty, for them there is no arising

original: na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: na vyayaḥ
translated: and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām
translated: Those which have no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of duration or change. The doors to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are naturally empty, and those which are naturally empty, for them there is no arising

original: notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / abhijñā prakṛtiśūnyā yāś ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ tāsāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate abhijñā prakṛti śūnyā yāḥ ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ tāsām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: and no passing away.🔽Those which have no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of duration or change. The superknowledges are naturally empty, and those which are naturally empty, for them there is no arising and no passing away.

original: yāsāṃ notpādo na vyayo na tāsāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / samādhayaḥ prakṛtiśūnyā ye ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yāsām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tāsām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate samādhayaḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ ye ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Those which have no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of duration or change. The concentrations are naturally empty, and those which are naturally empty, for them there is no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / dhāraṇīmukhāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate dhāraṇīmukhāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Those for whom there is no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of remaining or changing. The dhāraṇī gateways are naturally empty, and those that are naturally empty have no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / daśatathāgatabalāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /🔽yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / catvāri vaiśāradyāni prakṛtiśūnyāni yāni ca prakṛtiśūnyāni teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate daśa tathāgata balāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ  yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate catvāri vaiśāradyāni prakṛti śūnyāni yāni ca prakṛti śūnyāni teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Those for whom there is no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of remaining or changing. The ten powers of the Tathāgata are naturally empty, and those that are naturally empty have no arising and no passing away.🔽Those for whom there is no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of remaining or changing. The four forms of fearlessness are naturally empty, and those that are naturally empty have no arising and no passing away.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ prakṛtiśūnyā yāś ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ tāsāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ yāḥ ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ tāsām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: Those for whom there is no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of remaining or changing. The four detailed and thorough knowledges are naturally empty, and those that are naturally empty have no arising and no passing away.

original: yāsāṃ notpādo na vyayo na tāsāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajnāyate / mahāmaitrī prakṛtiśūnyā
analyzed: yāsām nā utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tāsām sthiti anyathātvam prajnāyate mahā maitrī prakṛti śūnyā
translated: Those for whom there is no arising and no passing away, for them there is no conceptualization of remaining or changing. Great love is naturally empty,

original: yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: And that which is empty of intrinsic nature has no origination and no cessation.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / mahākaruṇā prakṛtiśūnyā yā ca prakṛtiśūnyā tasyā notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate mahā karuṇā prakṛti śūnyā yā ca prakṛti śūnyā tasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no origination and no cessation, no abiding and no transformation can be discerned. Great compassion is empty of intrinsic nature. And that which is empty of intrinsic nature has no origination and no cessation.

original: yasyā notpādo na vyayo na tasyāḥ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate / āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ prakṛtiśūnyā ye ca prakṛtiśūnyāḥ teṣāṃ notpādo na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na tasyāḥ sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ ye ca prakṛti śūnyāḥ teṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: For that which has no origination and no cessation, no abiding and no transformation can be discerned. The unique qualities of a Buddha are empty of intrinsic nature. And those which are empty of intrinsic nature have no origination and no cessation.

original: yeṣāṃ notpādo na vyayo na teṣāṃ sthityanyathātvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yeṣām na utpādaḥ na vyayaḥ na teṣām sthiti anyathātvam prajñāyate
translated: For those which have no origination and no cessation, no abiding and no transformation can be discerned.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad rūpaṃ /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā vedanā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat rūpam  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā vedanā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is unconditioned is not form.🔽That which is unconditioned is not feeling.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā saṃjñā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā saṃjñā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not perception.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te saṃskārāḥ
translated: Those which are unconditioned are not volitional formations.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad vijñānam /🔽yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tac cakṣuḥ /🔽yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tac chrotraṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat vijñānam  yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat cakṣuḥ  yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat śrotram
translated: That which is unconditioned is not consciousness.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the eye.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the ear.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad ghrāṇaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat ghrāṇam
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the nose.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā jihvā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā jihvā
translated: That tongue is not fabricated.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa kāyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa kāyaḥ
translated: That body is not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tan manaḥ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat manaḥ
translated: That mind is not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad rūpaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat rūpam
translated: That form is not fabricated.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa śabdaḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa gandhaḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa rasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa śabdaḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa gandhaḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa rasaḥ
translated: That sound is not fabricated.🔽That smell is not fabricated.🔽That taste is not fabricated.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa sparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa sparśaḥ
translated: That touch is not fabricated.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te dharmāḥ /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te dharmāḥ
translated: Those dharmas are not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tac cakṣurvijñānaṃ /🔽yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tac chrotravijñānaṃ /🔽yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad ghrāṇavijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat cakṣuḥ vijñānam  yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat śrotra vijñānam  yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat ghrāṇa vijñānam
translated: That eye consciousness is not fabricated.🔽That ear consciousness is not fabricated.🔽That nose consciousness is not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad jihvāvijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat jihvā vijñānam
translated: That tongue consciousness is not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tat kāyavijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat kāya vijñānam
translated: That body consciousness is not fabricated.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tan manovijñānam /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa śrotrasaṃsparśaḥ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat manaḥ vijñānam  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa śrotra saṃsparśaḥ
translated: That mind consciousness is not fabricated.🔽That eye contact is not fabricated.🔽That ear contact is not fabricated.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa ghrāṇasaṃsparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ
translated: That nose contact is not fabricated.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa jihvāsaṃsparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa jihvā saṃsparśaḥ
translated: That which is unconditioned is not tongue contact.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa kāyasaṃsparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa kāya saṃsparśaḥ
translated: That which is unconditioned is not body contact.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa manaḥsaṃsparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ
translated: That which is unconditioned is not mind contact.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā  yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā  yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from eye contact.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from ear contact.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from nose contact.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from tongue contact.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from body contact.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from mind contact.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa pṛthivīdhātuḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na so 'bdhātuḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa tejodhātuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa pṛthivī dhātuḥ  yaḥ n abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na saḥ b dhātuḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa tejaḥ dhātuḥ
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the earth element.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the water element.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the fire element.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa vāyudhātuḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa ākāśadhātuḥ /🔽yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa vijñānadhātuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa vāyu dhātuḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na saḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ  yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa vijñāna dhātuḥ
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the wind element.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the space element.🔽That which is unconditioned is not the consciousness element.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sāvidyā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā avidyā
translated: That which is unconditioned is not ignorance.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te saṃskārāḥ
translated: What is not conditioned is not formations.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat vijñānam
translated: What is not conditioned is not consciousness.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tan nāmarūpaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat nāma rūpam
translated: What is not conditioned is not name-and-form.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tat ṣaḍāyatanaṃ /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: What is not conditioned is not the six sense bases.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa sparśaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa sparśaḥ
translated: What is not conditioned is not contact.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā vedanā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā vedanā
translated: What is not conditioned is not feeling.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā tṛṣṇā /🔽yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na tad upādānaṃ /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā tṛṣṇā  yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat upādānam
translated: What is not conditioned is not craving.🔽What is not conditioned is not grasping.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa bhavaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na sa bhavaḥ
translated: What is not conditioned is not becoming.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā jātiḥ /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā jātiḥ
translated: What is not conditioned is not birth.

original: yad anabhisaṃskṛtaṃ na taj jarāmaraṇam /
analyzed: yat an abhisaṃskṛtam na tat jarā maraṇam
translated: What is not conditioned is not old age and death.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā dāna pāramitā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the perfection of giving.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā śīlapāramitā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā śīla pāramitā  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā kṣānti pāramitā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the perfection of morality.🔽What is not conditioned is not the perfection of patience.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā vīrya pāramitā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the perfection of vigor.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the perfection of concentration.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā prajñāpāramitā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sādhyātmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā prajñāpāramitā  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā adhyātma śūnyatā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the perfection of wisdom.🔽What is not conditioned is not the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā bahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: What is not conditioned is not the emptiness of external phenomena.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of internal and external.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā śūnyatāśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahāśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā śūnyatā aśūnyatā  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahāśūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of emptiness.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the great emptiness.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā paramārthaśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā saṃskṛtaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā paramārtha śūnyatā  yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā saṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sātyantaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā atyanta śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of the infinite.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sānavarāgraśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sānavakāraśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā an avara agra śūnyatā  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā an avakāra śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarvadharmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sānupalambhaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā  yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sābhāvaśūnyatā /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā svabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā abhāvaśūnyatā  yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na sā svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of non-existence.🔽That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of own-nature.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: That which is not fabricated is not the emptiness of the non-existence of own-nature.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni smṛtyupasthānāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni smṛti upasthānāni
translated: Those which are not fabricated are not the applications of mindfulness.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni samyakprahāṇāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni samyak prahāṇāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the right efforts.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te ṛddhipādāḥ yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tānīndriyāṇi /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te ṛddhipādāḥ yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni indriyāṇi
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the bases of spiritual power. Those that are not brought together are not the faculties.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni balāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni balāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the powers.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni bodhyaṅgāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the branches of enlightenment.

original: yo 'nabhisaṃskṛto na sa āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na abhisaṃskṛtaḥ na saḥ ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: That which is not brought together is not the noble eightfold path.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāny āryasatyāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni ārya satyāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the noble truths.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni dhyānāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni dhyānāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the meditative absorptions.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāny apramāṇāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni apramāṇāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the immeasurables.

original: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na tā ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na tāḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the formless attainments.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te vimokṣāḥ /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te vimokṣāḥ
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the liberations.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na tā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na tāḥ navā anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the doors of liberation through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na tā abhijñāḥ /🔽ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te samādhayaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na tāḥ abhijñāḥ  ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te samādhayaḥ
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the superknowledges.🔽Those that are not brought together are not the meditative stabilities.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni dhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni dhāraṇīmukhāni
translated: Those that are not brought together are not the doors of dhāraṇī.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni daśatathāgatabalāni /
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: Those that are not compounded are not the ten powers of a tathāgata.

original: yāny anabhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni catvāri
analyzed: yāni an abhisaṃskṛtāni na tāni catvāri
translated: Those that are not compounded are not the four

original: vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni
translated: fearlessnesses.

original: yā anabhisaṃskṛtā na tāś catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ /🔽yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahāmaitrī /
analyzed: yāḥ an abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na tāḥ catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ  yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahā maitrī
translated: Those that are not compounded are not the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽That which is not compounded is not great love.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā mahā karuṇā
translated: That which is not compounded is not great compassion.

original: ye 'nabhisaṃskṛtā na te 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: ye na abhisaṃskṛtāḥ na te ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: Those that are not compounded are not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarvajñatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarvajña tā
translated: That which is not compounded is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā mārgākārajñatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā mārga ākāra jña tā
translated: That which is not compounded is not the knowledge of path aspects.

original: yānabhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: yā an abhisaṃskṛtā na sā sarva ākārajña tā
translated: That which is not compounded is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yat punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputraivam āha /
analyzed: yat punar āyuṣman śāradvatīputra evam āha
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you said:

original: kena kāraṇenaivaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena evam vadasi
translated: For what reason do you say this?

original: tat kim anabhinirvṛttaṃ prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyām anuśāsiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: tat kim an abhinirvṛttam prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyām anuśāsiṣyāmi iti
translated: Is it that you will instruct and teach in the perfection of wisdom that which is not fully awakened to?

original: tathā hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra yānabhinirvṛttiḥ sā prajñāpāramitā yā prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra yā an abhinirvṛttiḥ sā prajñāpāramitā yā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is because that which is not fully awakened to is the perfection of wisdom, and that which is the perfection of wisdom🔽is not fully awakened to.

original: sānābhinirvṛttir iti hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca prajñāpāramitā cābhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: sā an abhinirvṛttiḥ iti hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca prajñāpāramitā ca abhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Non-arising and the perfection of wisdom are non-existent, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇaivaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: anena āyuṣman chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa evam vadasi
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you say this:

original: tat kim anabhinirvṛttiṃ prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyāmy anuśāsiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat kim an abhinirvṛttim prajñāpāramitāyām avavadiṣyāmi anuśāsiṣyāmi
translated: Should I instruct and teach in the perfection of wisdom that which is non-arising?

original: yat punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputraivam āha /
analyzed: yat punar āyuṣman śāradvatīputra evam āha
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you also said:

original: kena kāraṇena nānyatrābhivṛttyā bodhisattva upalabhyate yo bodhāya cared iti / tathā
analyzed: kena kāraṇena na anyatra abhivṛttyā bodhisattvaḥ upalabhyate yaḥ bodhāya caret iti tathā
translated: For what reason is a bodhisattva not perceived apart from non-arising, who would practice for enlightenment?

original: hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāñ caran nānyam
analyzed: hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran na anyam
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not see

original: anabhinirvṛttim anyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ samanupaśyati / iti hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca bodhisattvaś
analyzed: an abhinirvṛttim anyam bodhisattvam samanupaśyati iti hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ
translated: any non-arising and any bodhisattva as separate. Thus, non-arising and

original: cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: a bodhisattva, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā rūpaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā rūpam samanupaśyati
translated: One does not see form as separate from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca rūpaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā vedanā samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ saṃjñāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca saṃjñā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ saṃskārān samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca rūpam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā vedanā samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ saṃjñām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca saṃjñā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ saṃskārān samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and form, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see feeling anywhere other than non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and feeling, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see perception anywhere other than non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and perception, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see volitional formations anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca saṃskārāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā vijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca saṃskārāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and volitional formations, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see consciousness anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and consciousness, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāś cakṣuḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ cakṣuḥ samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the eye anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca cakṣuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatranabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotraṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śrotraṃ 🔽cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ghrāṇaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā jihvāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca cakṣuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotram samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca śrotram  ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇam samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ghrāṇam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā jihvām samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the eye—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the ear in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the ear—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the nose in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the nose—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the tongue in non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jihvā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāyaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca jihvā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāyam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the tongue—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the body in non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca kāyaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ manaḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca kāyaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ manaḥ samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the body—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the mind in non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca manaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca manaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and the mind—these two phenomena are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā rūpaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca rūpaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ śabdaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā rūpam samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca rūpam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ śabdam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see form apart from non-arising.🔽Because non-arising and form, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see sound apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śabdaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā gandhaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca gandhaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā rasaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca śabdaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā gandham samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca gandhaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ rasam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-arising and sound, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see smell apart from non-arising.🔽Because non-arising and smell, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see taste apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca rasaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ sparśaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca rasaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ sparśam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-arising and taste, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see touch apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca sparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā dharmān samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca sparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā dharmān samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-arising and touch, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see dharmas apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca dharmāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca dharmāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and phenomena, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāś cakṣurvijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ cakṣuḥ vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see eye-consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinivṛttiś ca cakṣurvijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotravijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinivṛttiḥ ca cakṣuḥ vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotra vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and eye-consciousness, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see ear-consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinivṛttiś ca śrotravṇñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāraṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinivṛttiḥ ca śrotra vṇñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and ear-consciousness, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: śrotravijñānam / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇavijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇa vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: ear-consciousness. He does not see nose-consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ghrāṇavijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā jihvāvijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
