analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca ghrāṇa vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛttyā jihvā vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and nose-consciousness, these two dharmas, are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see tongue-consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jihvāvijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāyavyñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca jihvā vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāya vyñānam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and tongue consciousness—these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see body consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca kāyavijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv o advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā manovijñānaṃ samanunpaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca kāya vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau o advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛttyā manaḥ vijñānam
translated: Because non-manifestation and body consciousness—these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see mind consciousness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca manovijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca manaḥ vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and mind consciousness—these two things are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāś cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ cakṣuḥ saṃsparśam samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam
translated: He does not see eye contact apart from non-manifestation.

original: advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotrasaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotra saṃsparśam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and eye contact—these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see ear contact apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śrotrasaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇasaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ghrāṇasaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā jihvāsaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca śrotra saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇa saṃsparśam samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛttyā jihvā saṃsparśam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and ear-contact, these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see nose-contact in non-manifestation,🔽Because non-manifestation and nose-contact, these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see tongue-contact in non-manifestation,

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jihvāsaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāyasaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca jihvā saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāya saṃsparśam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and tongue-contact, these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see body-contact in non-manifestation,

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca kāyasaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā manaḥsaṃsparśaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca kāya saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā manaḥ saṃsparśam samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and body-contact, these two things are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see mind-contact in non-manifestation,

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca manaḥsaṃsparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and mind-contact, these two things are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāś cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ
analyzed: na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām
translated: He does not consider the feeling that arises from contact with the eye apart from non-arising.🔽Because non-arising and the feeling that arises from contact with the eye—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not consider the feeling that arises from contact with the ear apart from non-arising.🔽Because non-arising and the feeling that arises from contact with the ear—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not consider the feeling that arises from contact with the nose apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām 🔽tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyāḥ kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām
translated: Because non-arising and the feeling that arises from contact with the nose—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not consider the feeling that arises from contact with the tongue apart from non-arising.🔽Because non-arising and the feeling that arises from contact with the tongue—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not consider the feeling that arises from contact with the body apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām
translated: Because non-manifestation and the feeling that arises from the contact of body and mind are both non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the feeling that arises from the contact of mind and mind apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and the feeling that arises from the contact of mind and mind are both non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ pṛthivīdhātuṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca pṛthivīdhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter abdhātuṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cābdhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ tejodhātuṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ pṛthivī dhātum samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca pṛthivī dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ ap dhātum samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca ap dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ tejaḥ dhātum samanupaśyati
translated: One does not see the earth element apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the earth element are both non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the water element apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the water element are both non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the fire element apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca tejodhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter vāyudhātuṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca tejaḥ dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ vāyu dhātum samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the fire element are both non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the wind element apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vāyudhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkārm / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter ākāśadhātuṃ 🔽samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca vāyu dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkārm na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ ākāśa dhātum  samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the wind element, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the space element as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ākāśadhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter vijñānadhātuṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca ākāśa dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ vijñāna dhātum samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the space element, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see consciousness as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vijñānadhātuś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca vijñāna dhātuḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: For thus non-manifestation and consciousness, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter avidyāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāvidyā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ saṃskārān samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ avidyām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca avidyā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ saṃskārān samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see ignorance as other than non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and ignorance, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the formations as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca saṃskārāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter vijñānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca saṃskārāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ vijñānam samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the formations, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see consciousness as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vijñānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter nāmarūpaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca vijñānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ nāma rūpam samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-arising and consciousness—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see name-and-form apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca nāmarūpaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ ṣaḍāyatanaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca nāma rūpam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ ṣaṣ āyatanam samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-arising and name-and-form—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the six sense bases apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ṣaḍāyatanaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ sparśaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca sparśaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter vedanāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ṣaṣ āyatanam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ sparśam samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca sparśaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ vedanām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-arising and the six sense bases—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see contact apart from non-arising.🔽Thus, non-arising and contact—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see feeling apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vedanā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ tṛṣṇāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca vedanā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ tṛṣṇām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-arising and feeling—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see craving apart from non-arising.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca tṛṣṇā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter upādānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca tṛṣṇā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ upādānam samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and craving, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see clinging anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca upādānaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter bhavaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca bhavaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter jātiṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca upādānam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ bhavam samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca bhavaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ jātim samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and clinging, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see becoming anywhere other than non-manifestation.🔽Thus, non-manifestation and becoming, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see birth anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jātiś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter jarāmaraṇaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca jātiḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ jarā maraṇam samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and birth, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see old age and death anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca jarāmaraṇaṃ cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca jarā maraṇam ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and old age and death, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter dānapāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ dāna pāramitām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the perfection of giving anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca dānapāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter śīlapāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śīlapāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter kṣāntipāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca dāna pāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ śīla pāramitām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca śīla pāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ kṣānti pāramitām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the perfection of generosity, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the perfection of morality anywhere other than non-manifestation.🔽Thus, non-manifestation and the perfection of morality, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the perfection of patience anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca kṣāntipāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter vīryapāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca kṣānti pāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ vīrya pāramitām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the perfection of patience, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the perfection of effort anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca vīryapāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca vīrya pāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the perfection of effort, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter dhyānapāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ dhyāna pāramitām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the perfection of meditation anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca dhyānapāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter prajñāpāramitāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca dhyāna pāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ prajñāpāramitām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the perfection of meditation, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the perfection of wisdom anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca prajñāpāramitā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca prajñāpāramitā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the perfection of wisdom, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter adhyātmaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cādhyātmaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca bahirdhāśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ adhyātma śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca adhyātma śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ bahirdhā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca bahirdhā śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of internal as other than non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of internal, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of external as other than non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of external, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of internal and external as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ śūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ śūnyatā aśūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of internal and external, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of emptiness as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca śūnyatāśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter mahāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca mahāśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ paramārthaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca paramārthaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ saṃskṛtaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca śūnyatā aśūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ mahāśūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca mahāśūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ paramārtha śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca paramārtha śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and emptiness of emptiness, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of the great elsewhere than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca saṃskṛtaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca saṃskṛta śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ asaṃskṛta śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of the great, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of the ultimate elsewhere than non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of the ultimate, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of the conditioned elsewhere than non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of the conditioned, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of the unconditioned elsewhere than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter atyantaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cātyantaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter anavarāgraśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cānavarāgraśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter anavakāraśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca asaṃskṛta śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ atyanta śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca atyanta śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ an avara agra śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca an avara agra śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ anavakāra śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and unconditioned emptiness, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of the ultimate apart from non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of the ultimate, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless apart from non-manifestation.🔽For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of non-disappearance apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cānavakāraśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca anavakāra śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ prakṛti śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus non-manifestation and the emptiness of non-disappearance, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness of inherent existence apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca prakṛtiśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca sarvadharmaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter anupalambhaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca prakṛti śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ sarva dharma śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca sarva dharma śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ anupalambha śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus, non-manifestation and natural emptiness, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of all phenomena apart from non-manifestation.🔽For thus, non-manifestation and the emptiness of all phenomena, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of specific characteristics apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cānupalambhaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter abhāvaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca anupalambha śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ abhāva śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: For thus, non-manifestation and the emptiness of specific characteristics, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of non-apprehension apart from non-manifestation.🔽For thus, non-manifestation and the emptiness of non-apprehension, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of non-existence apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cābhāvaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca svabhāvaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca abhāva śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ svabhāva śūnyatām samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca svabhāva śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and emptiness of non-existence, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of own-nature apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the emptiness of own-nature, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because non-manifestation and the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided.

original: nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ smṛtyupasthānāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ smṛti upasthānāni samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the applications of mindfulness apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca smṛtyupasthānāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ samyakprahāṇāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca smṛti upasthānāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ samyakprahāṇāni samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the applications of mindfulness, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided. He does not see the right efforts apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca samyakprahāṇāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter ṛddhipādān samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca samyakprahāṇāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ ṛddhipādān samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the right efforts—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the bases of spiritual power apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca ṛddhipādāṃś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter indriyāṇi samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cendriyāṇi cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter balāni samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca balāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter bodhyaṅgāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ṛddhipādān ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ indriyāṇi samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca indriyāṇi ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ balāni samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca balāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ bodhyaṅgāni samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the bases of spiritual power—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the powers apart from non-manifestation.🔽Thus, non-manifestation and the powers—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the limbs of awakening apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca bodhyaṅgāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca bodhyaṅgāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgam samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the limbs of awakening—these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the noble eightfold path apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter āryasatyāni samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāryasatyāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter dhyānāni samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca dhyānāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter apramāṇāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ ārya satyāni samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ārya satyāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ dhyānāni samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca dhyānāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ apramāṇāni samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the noble eightfold path—these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the noble truths apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the noble truths—these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the concentrations apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the concentrations—these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the immeasurables apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāpramāṇāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter ārūpyasamāpattīḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca apramāṇāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the immeasurables—these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the formless concentrations apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cārūpyasamāpattiś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter aṣṭau vimokṣāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca ārūpya samāpattiḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ aṣṭau vimokṣām samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the formless concentrations—these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. One does not see the eight liberations apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāṣṭau vimokṣāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the eight liberations, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the nine successive concentrations anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the nine successive concentrations, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the emptiness, signless, and wishless doors to liberation anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the emptiness, signless, and wishless doors to liberation, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four formless concentrations anywhere else than in non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ 🔽śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāpramāṇāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter abhijñāḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ  śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni samanupaśyati  tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca apramāṇāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ abhijñāḥ samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the four formless concentrations, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four noble truths anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the four noble truths, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the five eyes anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the five eyes, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the six superknowledges anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the six superknowledges, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four means of drawing in and attracting people anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the four means of drawing in and attracting people, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four ways of attracting people anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the four ways of attracting people, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening anywhere else than in non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cābhijñāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ samādhīn samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca abhijñāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ samādhīn samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the ten powers of the Tathāgata anywhere else than in non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the ten powers of the Tathāgata, these

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca samādhayaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter dhāraṇīmukhāni samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca dhāraṇīmukhāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter daśatathāgatabalāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca samādhayaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ dhāraṇī mukhāni samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca dhāraṇīmukhāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ daśa tathāgata balāni samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the meditative absorptions, these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the dhāraṇī gateways apart from non-manifestation.🔽Because non-manifestation and the dhāraṇī gateways, these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the ten powers of the Tathāgata apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca daśatathāgatabalāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteś catvāri vaiśāradyāni samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca daśa tathāgata balāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ catvāri vaiśāradyāni samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the ten powers of the Tathāgata, these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four fearlessnesses apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca catvāri vaiśāradyāni cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteś catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca catvāri vaiśāradyāni ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samanupaśyati
translated: Because non-manifestation and the four fearlessnesses, these dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the four detailed and thorough knowledges apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter mahāmaitrīṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ mahā maitrīm samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the four analytical knowledges, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see great love apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca mahāmaitrī cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter mahākaruṇāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca mahāmaitrī ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ mahā karuṇām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and great love, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see great compassion apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca mahākaruṇā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca mahā karuṇā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and great compassion, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś cāṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāś cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ sarvajñatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi anabhinirvṛttiḥ ca aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra anabhinirvṛtteḥ sarvajña tām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see all-knowledge apart from non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca sarvajñatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtter mārgākārajñatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca mārgākārajñatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram / nānyatrānabhinirvṛtteḥ sarvākārajñatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca sarvajña tā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ mārga ākāra jña tām samanupaśyati  tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca mārga ākāra jña tā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram na anyatra an abhinirvṛtteḥ sarva ākāra jña tām samanupaśyati
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and omniscience, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the knowledge of the aspects of the path as other than non-manifestation.🔽Thus, non-manifestation and the knowledge of the aspects of the path, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two. He does not see the knowledge of all aspects as other than non-manifestation.

original: tathā hy anabhinirvṛttiś ca sarvākārajñatā cobhāv etau dharmāv advayam advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhinirvṛttiḥ ca sarva ākāra jña tā ca ubhau etau dharmau advayam a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, non-manifestation and the knowledge of all aspects, these two dharmas are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa nānyatrānabhinirvṛttyā bodhisattva upalabhyate yo bodhāya caret /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa na anyatra anabhinirvṛttyā bodhisattvaḥ upalabhyate yaḥ bodhāya caret
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva who would practice for awakening is not apprehended anywhere other than non-manifestation.

original: yat punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputraivam āha kena kāraṇenaivaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: yat punar āyuṣman śāradvatī putra evam āha kena kāraṇena evam vadasi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, as for what you said: 'For what reason do you say this?'

original: sacet bodhisatto mahāsattva evam uddiśyamānenotrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam
analyzed: saced bodhisattaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, being thus instructed, is not frightened, does not tremble, does not quake,

original: āpadyate carati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ tathā hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra
analyzed: āpadyate carati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām tathā hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra
translated: and practices the perfection of wisdom, because the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: nirīhakāt sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati / svapnopamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: nirīhakāt sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati svapna upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati
translated: does not see any dharmas as having activity, does not see all dharmas as dream-like,

original: māyopamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati / mārīcyupamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: māyā upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati mārīci upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati
translated: does not see all dharmas as illusion-like, does not see all dharmas as mirage-like,

original: pratiśrutkopamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati / pratibhāsopamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: pratiśrutkā upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati pratibhāsa upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati
translated: does not see all dharmas as echo-like, does not see all dharmas as reflection-like,

original: nirmitopamān sarvadharmān na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: nirmita upamān sarva dharmān na samanupaśyati
translated: does not see all dharmas as magical creation-like.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvā notrasyati saṃtrasati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam nirdeśam śrutvā na utrasyati saṃtrasati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: By this method, venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having heard this teaching, does not tremble, is not frightened, and does not become terrified in the perfection of wisdom.

original: athāyuṣman subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣman subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate /
analyzed: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate
translated: Blessed One, when a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom examines these dharmas in this way,

original: tasmin samaye rūpaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati rūpam etad iti /🔽tasmin samaye vedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vedaneyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye rūpam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati rūpam etat iti  tasmin samaye vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vedanā iyam iti
translated: at that time he does not approach form, does not grasp it, does not rely on it, does not settle down on it, does not imagine it, does not designate it as 'this is form.'🔽At that time he does not approach feeling, does not grasp it, does not rely on it, does not settle down on it, does not imagine it, does not designate it as 'this is feeling.'

original: tasmin samaye saṃjñāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃjñeyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye saṃjñām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃjñā iyam iti
translated: At that time he does not approach perception, does not grasp it, does not rely on it, does not settle down on it, does not imagine it, does not designate it as 'this is perception.'

original: tasmin samaye saṃskārān nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃskārā ima iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye saṃskārān na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃskārāḥ ime iti
translated: At that time he does not approach volitional formations, does not grasp them, does not rely on them, does not settle down on them, does not imagine them, does not designate them as 'these are volitional formations.'

original: tasmin samaye vijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vijñānam etat iti
translated: At that time he does not approach consciousness, does not grasp it, does not rely on it, does not settle down on it, does not imagine it, does not designate it as 'this is consciousness.'

original: tasmin samaye cakṣur nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣur etad iti /🔽tasmin samaye śrotraṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotram etad iti /🔽tasmin samaye ghrāṇaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥ na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥ etat iti  tasmin samaye śrotram na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotram etat iti  tasmin samaye ghrāṇam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇam etat iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the eye, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the eye.'🔽At that time, he does not approach the ear, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the ear.'🔽At that time, he does not approach the nose, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the nose.'

original: tasmin samaye jihvāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihveyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye jihvām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the tongue, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the tongue.'

original: tasmin samaye kāyaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāyo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye kāyam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāyaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the body, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the body.'

original: tasmin samaye mano nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati mana etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye manaḥ na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥ etat iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the mind, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'the mind.'

original: tasmin samaye rūpaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati rūpam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye rūpam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati rūpam etat iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach form, does not grasp it, does not establish it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive of it as 'form.'

original: tasmin samaye śabdaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śabdo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye śabdam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śabdaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach sound, does not grasp it, does not stand on it, does not become attached to it, does not imagine it as 'sound'.

original: tasmin samaye gandhaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati gandho 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye gandham na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati gandhaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach smell, does not grasp it, does not stand on it, does not become attached to it, does not imagine it as 'smell'.

original: tasmin samaye rasaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati
analyzed: tasmin samaye rasam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati
translated: At that time, he does not approach taste, does not grasp it, does not stand on it,

original: nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati raso 'yam iti /
analyzed: na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati rasaḥ yam iti
translated: does not become attached to it, does not imagine it as 'taste'.🔽At that time, he does not approach touch, does not grasp it, does not stand on it,

original: tasmin samaye sparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati sparśao 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye sparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati yam iti
translated: does not become attached to it, does not imagine it as 'touch'.🔽At that time, he does not approach mental phenomena, does not grasp them, does not stand on them,

original: tasmin samaye dharmān nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dharmā ima iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye dharmān na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dharmāḥ ime iti
translated: does not become attached to them, does not imagine them as 'these are mental phenomena'.🔽At that time, he does not approach eye-consciousness, does not grasp it, does not stand on it,

original: tasmin samaye cakṣurvijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣurvijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥ vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥ vijñānam etat iti
translated: does not become attached to it, does not imagine it as 'this is eye-consciousness'.

original: tasmin samaye śrotravijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotravijñānam etad iti /🔽tasmin samaye ghrāṇavijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajftāpayati ghrāṇavijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye śrotra vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotra vijñānam etat iti  tasmin samaye ghrāṇa vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajftāpayati ghrāṇa vijñānam etat iti
translated: At that time, ear-consciousness is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.🔽At that time, nose-consciousness is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.

original: tasmin samaye jihvāvijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvāvijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye jihvā vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvā vijñānam etat iti
translated: At that time, tongue-consciousness is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.

original: tasmin samaye kāyavijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāyavijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye kāya vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāya vijñānam etat iti
translated: At that time, body-consciousness is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.

original: tasmin samaye manovijñānaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manovijñānam etad iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye manaḥ vijñānam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥ vijñānam etat iti
translated: At that time, mind-consciousness is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.

original: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥ saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, eye-contact is not appropriated, not taken up, not adhered to, not grasped, not declared to be ‘mine,’ and not regarded thus.

original: tasmin samaye śrotrasaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotrasaṃsparśo 'yam iti /🔽tasmin samaye ghrāṇasaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇasaṃsparśo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye śrotra saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotra saṃsparśaḥ yam iti  tasmin samaye ghrāṇa saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not adhere to, and does not designate ear-contact as 'this is ear-contact.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not adhere to, and does not designate nose-contact as 'this is nose-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye jihvāsaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvāsaṃsparśo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye jihvā saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvā saṃsparśaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not adhere to, and does not designate tongue-contact as 'this is tongue-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye kāyasaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāyasaṃsparśo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye kāya saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāya saṃsparśaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not adhere to, and does not designate body-contact as 'this is body-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye manaḥsaṃsparśaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥsaṃsparśo 'yam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye manaḥ saṃsparśam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ yam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not adhere to, and does not designate mind-contact as 'this is mind-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam
analyzed: tasmin samaye cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam
translated: At that time, he does not accept, does not grasp, does not dwell on, does not become attached to, and does not conceptualize the feeling that arises from eye-contact as 'the feeling that arises from eye-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam🔽tasmin samaye ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam
analyzed: tasmin samaye śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam  tasmin samaye ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam
translated: At that time, he does not accept, does not grasp, does not dwell on, does not become attached to, and does not conceptualize the feeling that arises from ear-contact as 'the feeling that arises from ear-contact.'🔽At that time, he does not accept, does not grasp, does not dwell on, does not become attached to, and does not conceptualize the feeling that arises from nose-contact as 'the feeling that arises from nose-contact.'

original: tasmin samaye jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ
analyzed: tasmin samaye jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam iti 🔽tasmin samaye kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām
translated: At that time, he does not accept, does not grasp, does not dwell on, does not become attached to, and does not conceptualize the feeling that arises from tongue-contact as 'the feeling that arises from tongue-contact.'🔽At that time, he does not accept, does not grasp, does not dwell on, does not become attached to, and does not conceptualize the feeling that arises from body-contact as 'the feeling that arises from body-contact.'

original: nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam iti /
analyzed: na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam iti
translated: He does not approach, does not grasp, does not conceive, does not insist, and does not designate that 'bodily contact and mental contact are to be felt.'

original: tasmin samaye manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not conceive, does not insist, and does not designate that 'mental contact and mental contact are to be felt.'

original: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate /🔽tasmin samaye dānapāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dānapāramiteyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye śīlapāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śīlapāramiteyam iti /
analyzed: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate  tasmin samaye dāna pāramitām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dāna pāramitā iyam iti  tasmin samaye śīla pāramitām na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śīla pāramitā iyam iti
translated: At that time, Blessed One, when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom and examines these dharmas in this way,🔽at that time he does not approach, does not grasp, does not conceive, does not insist, and does not designate that 'this is the perfection of giving.'🔽At that time he does not approach, does not grasp, does not conceive, does not insist, and does not designate that 'this is the perfection of morality.'

original: tasmin samaye kṣāntipāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kṣāntipāramiteyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye kṣānti pāramitām na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati kṣānti pāramitā iyam iti
translated: At that time he does not approach, does not grasp, does not conceive, does not insist, and does not designate that 'this is the perfection of patience.'

original: tasmin samaye vīryapāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vīryapāramiteyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye dhyānapāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dhyānapāramiteyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye vīrya pāramitām na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati vīrya pāramitā iyam iti  tasmin samaye dhyāna pāramitām na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati dhyāna pāramitā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the perfection of effort, does not take it up, does not stand in it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive it as 'this is the perfection of effort.'🔽At that time, he does not approach the perfection of meditation, does not take it up, does not stand in it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive it as 'this is the perfection of meditation.'

original: tasmin samaye prajñāpāramitāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati prajñāpāramiteyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye 'dhyātmaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty adhyātmaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye prajñāpāramitām na upaiti nā upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati prajñāpāramitā iyam iti  tasmin samaye dhyātma śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati adhyātma śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the perfection of wisdom, does not take it up, does not stand in it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive it as 'this is the perfection of wisdom.'🔽At that time, he does not approach inner emptiness, does not take it up, does not stand in it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive it as 'this is inner emptiness.'

original: tasmin samaye bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati bahirdhāśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bahirdhā śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati bahirdhā śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach outer emptiness, does not take it up, does not stand in it, does not become attached to it, and does not conceive it as 'this is outer emptiness.'

original: tasmin samaye 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of internal and external, thinking 'this is the emptiness of internal and external'.

original: tasmin samaye śūnyatāśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śūnyatāśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye śūnyatā śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati śūnyatā śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of emptiness, thinking 'this is the emptiness of emptiness'.

original: tasmin samaye mahāśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati mahāśūnyateyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye paramārthaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati paramārthaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye mahā śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati mahā śūnyatā iyam iti  tasmin samaye paramārtha śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati paramārtha śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the great emptiness, thinking 'this is the great emptiness'.🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of the ultimate, thinking 'this is the emptiness of the ultimate'.

original: tasmin samaye saṃskṛtaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃskṛtaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye saṃskṛta śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati saṃskṛta śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, thinking 'this is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena'.

original: tasmin samaye 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty asaṃskṛtaśūnyateyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye 'tyantaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty atyantaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye saṃskṛta śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati a saṃskṛta śūnyatā iyam iti  tasmin samaye tyanta śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati atyanta śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached, does not designate the emptiness of the unconditioned as 'this is the emptiness of the unconditioned.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached, does not designate the ultimate emptiness as 'this is the ultimate emptiness.'

original: tasmin samaye 'navarāgraśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty anavarāgraśūnyateyam 🔽iti / tasmin samaye 'navakāraśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty anavakāraśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye navara agra śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati a navara agra śūnyatā iyam  iti tasmin samaye navakāra śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati an avakāra śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached, does not designate the emptiness of the beginningless and endless as 'this is the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.'

original: tasmin samaye prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati prakṛtiśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye prakṛti śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati prakṛti śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached, does not designate the emptiness of non-disappearance as 'this is the emptiness of non-disappearance.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached, does not designate the emptiness of inherent nature as 'this is the emptiness of inherent nature.'

original: tasmin samaye sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati sarvadharmaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye sarva dharma śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati sarva dharma śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of all phenomena, thinking 'this is the emptiness of all phenomena.'

original: tasmin samaye svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati svalakṣaṇaśūnyateyam iti /🔽tasmin samaye 'nupalambhaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty anupalambhaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā iyam iti  tasmin samaye nupalambha śūnyatām na upaiti nā upādatte nā adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati anupalambha śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of specific characteristics, thinking 'this is the emptiness of specific characteristics.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of non-apprehension, thinking 'this is the emptiness of non-apprehension.'

original: tasmin samaye 'bhāvaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty abhāvaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bhāva śūnyatām na upaiti nā upādatte nā adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati abhāva śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of non-existence, thinking 'this is the emptiness of non-existence.'

original: tasmin samaye svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayati svabhāvaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye svabhāva śūnyatām na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati svabhāva śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand upon, does not conceive, does not imagine the emptiness of own-nature, thinking 'this is the emptiness of own-nature.'

original: tasmin samaye 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñāpayaty abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyateyam iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bhāva svabhāva śūnyatām na upaiti nā upādatte nā adhitiṣṭhati nā abhiniviśate na prajñāpayati abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā iyam iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand in, does not settle down on, does not consider as, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence as 'this is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.'

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñapāramitāyāṃ caran smṛtyupasthānāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati 🔽smṛtyupasthānāny etānīti /🔽tasmin samaye samyakprahāṇāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati samyakprahāṇāny etānīti /🔽tasmin samaye ṛddhipādān nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati ṛddhipādā imā iti /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñapāramitāyām caran smṛti upasthānāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati  smṛti upasthānāni etāni iti  tasmin samaye samyakprahāṇāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati samyakprahāṇāni etāni iti  tasmin samaye ṛddhipādān na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati ṛddhipādāḥ imāḥ iti
translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand in, does not settle down on, does not consider as, the applications of mindfulness as 'these are the applications of mindfulness.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand in, does not settle down on, does not consider as, the right efforts as 'these are the right efforts.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand in, does not settle down on, does not consider as, the bases of supernatural power as 'these are the bases of supernatural power.'

original: tasmin samaye indriyāṇi nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayatīndriyāṇy etānīti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye indriyāṇi na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati indriyāṇi etāni iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not stand in, does not settle down on, does not consider as, the faculties as 'these are the faculties.'

original: tasmin samaye balāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati balānīmānīti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye balāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati balāni imāni iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the powers, does not take them up, does not dwell on them, does not conceive of them, does not insist on them as 'these are the powers.'

original: tasmin samaye bodhyaṅgāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati bodhyaṅgānīmānīti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bodhyaṅgāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati bodhyaṅgāni imāni iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the factors of awakening, does not take them up, does not dwell on them, does not conceive of them, does not insist on them as 'these are the factors of awakening.'

original: tasmin samaye āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty āryāṣṭaṅgo mārga iti /🔽tasmin samaye āryasatyāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty āryasatyāny etānīti /🔽tasmin samaye dhyānāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati dhyānāny etānīti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgam na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati ārya aṣṭaṅgaḥ mārgaḥ iti  tasmin samaye ārya satyāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati ārya satyāni etāni iti  tasmin samaye dhyānāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati dhyānāni etāni iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the noble eightfold path, does not take it up, does not dwell on it, does not conceive of it, does not insist on it as 'this is the noble eightfold path.'🔽At that time, he does not approach the noble truths, does not take them up, does not dwell on them, does not conceive of them, does not insist on them as 'these are the noble truths.'🔽At that time, he does not approach the concentrations, does not take them up, does not dwell on them, does not conceive of them, does not insist on them as 'these are the concentrations.'

original: tasmin samaye 'pramāṇāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty apramāṇāny etānīti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye pramāṇāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati a pramāṇāni etāni iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach the immeasurables, does not take them up, does not dwell on them, does not conceive of them, does not insist on them as 'these are the immeasurables.'

original: tasmin samaye ārūpyasamāpattīr nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty ārūpyasamāpattaya imā iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye ārūpya samāpattīḥ na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati ārūpya samāpattayaḥ imāḥ iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached to, does not designate the formless attainments as 'these are the formless attainments.'

original: tasmin samaye 'ṣṭau vimokṣān nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty aṣṭau vimokṣā
analyzed: tasmin samaye ṣṭau vimokṣān na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached to, does not designate the eight liberations as 'these are the eight liberations.'

original: ima iti / tasmin samaye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati navānupūrvavihārasamāpattaya 🔽imā iti /🔽tasmin samaye śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny
analyzed: ime iti tasmin samaye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ  imāḥ iti  tasmin samaye śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached to, does not designate the nine successive abodes as 'these are the nine successive abodes.'🔽At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached to, does not designate the emptiness, signless, and wishless liberations as 'these are the emptiness, signless, and wishless liberations.'

original: tasmin samaye 'bhijñā nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayaty abhijñā imā iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bhijñāḥ na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati abhijñāḥ imāḥ iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not establish, does not become attached to, does not designate the superknowledges as 'these are the superknowledges.'

original: tasmin samaye samādhīn nopaiti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśate na prajñapayati samādhaya ima iti /
analyzed: tasmin samaye samādhīn na upaiti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśate na prajñapayati samādhayaḥ ime iti
translated: At that time, he does not approach, does not grasp, does not actualize, does not conceive, does not imagine the concentrations, thinking 'these are the concentrations.'
